datareading

Class MultiDataReading

  • java.lang.Object
    • datareading.MultiDataReading

  • public class MultiDataReading
extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    Subrahmanyeswara Reddy Padala

    Inspired From QMetry Framework.
    QMetry Framework has got an excellent way to read data from an excel sheet using @QAFDataProvider annotation.
    But this can be used only with QMetry framework. Also, I think it lacks setting/updating data in excel.
    If you want to develop your own framework where you have data driven test cases, you need to write your own classes for reading and writing data to excel.
    So, prepared this class using which you can easily read data into a map and also you can set/update data in a cell.

    • Method Detail

      • getData

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>> getData(java.lang.String path,
                                                                                                 java.lang.String sheetName,
                                                                                                 java.lang.String key)

        getData(String path, String sheetName, String key)

        This method returns data from a key range specified in an excel sheet under a workbook.
        Parameters:
        path - Excel sheet path Ex: "C:/mydata/data.xlsx" or if the sheet is with in some folder like resources in the project under the root folder then "resources/data.xlsx"
        sheetName - Sheet name where data exists like "Sheet1"
        key - Key for the data. This has to be provided before data (before column names) and after data(after the last cell data.
        Returns:
        returns a map of integer, map. The second map is a map of String and String. The integer is the data row number starting from 1 with in the key range specified. Second map contains key value pairs of column name and actual value.
        Since:
        29/12/2019

      • getData

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>> getData(java.lang.String path,
                                                                                                 java.lang.String sheetName)

        getData(String path, String sheetName)

        This method returns data from an excel sheet under a workbook.
        Parameters:
        path - Excel sheet path Ex: "C:/mydata/data.xlsx" or if the sheet is with in some folder like resources in the project under the root folder then "resources/data.xlsx"
        sheetName - Sheet name where data exists like "Sheet1"
        Returns:
        returns a map of integer, map. The second map is a map of String and String. The integer is the data row number starting from 1. Second map contains key value pairs of column name and actual value.
        Since:
        29/12/2019

      • setData

        public boolean setData(java.lang.String path,
                       java.lang.String sheetName,
                       java.lang.String key,
                       int rowno,
                       java.lang.String colName,
                       java.lang.String value)

        setData(String path, String sheetName, String key, int rowno, String colName, String value)

        This method updates a particular cell data with in a key range specified in an excel sheet under a workbook.
        Parameters:
        path - Excel sheet path Ex: "C:/mydata/data.xlsx" or if the sheet is with in some folder like resources in the project under the root folder then "resources/data.xlsx"
        sheetName - Sheet name where data exists like "Sheet1"
        key - Key for the data. This has to be provided before data (before column names) and after data(after the last cell data.
        rowno - This is the data row number (not including the column names) starting from 1 with in the key range.
        colName - Name of the column where the cell has to be updated.
        value - Value that has to be updated.
        Returns:
        returns boolean value true, if the data is updated successfully.
        Since:
        29/12/2019

      • setData

        public boolean setData(java.lang.String path,
                       java.lang.String sheetName,
                       int rowno,
                       java.lang.String colName,
                       java.lang.String value)

        setData(String path, String sheetName, int rowno, String colName, String value)

        This method updates a particular cell data in an excel sheet under a workbook.
        Parameters:
        path - Excel sheet path Ex: "C:/mydata/data.xlsx" or if the sheet is with in some folder like resources in the project under the root folder then "resources/data.xlsx"
        sheetName - Sheet name where data exists like "Sheet1"
        rowno - This is the data row number (not including the column names) starting from 1 with in the key range.
        colName - Name of the column where the cell has to be updated.
        value - Value that has to be updated.
        Returns:
        returns boolean value true, if the data is updated successfully.
        Since:
        29/12/2019
